Reason: The configuration option 'memtable_allocation_type' is performance-sensitive. This is because the 'memtable_allocation_type' directly impacts the type of MemtablePool created in the createMemtableAllocatorPool method, which in turn affects the memory usage and cleanup operations of the memtables. The switch statement in the code snippet shows that different allocation types lead to different MemtablePool implementations, which can have notable performance variations at the system level based on the memory allocation and cleanup strategies chosen.
